intro: Vilfa pallida, commonly known as the pale vilfa, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, pale yellow to white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine layer of white hair, which helps reduce water loss. Vilfa pallida is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to arid environments.
